availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alexander Bell Patrick (Breathitt Co & Cir Ct Clerk, private CSA)

body.p: Breathitt County, Kentucky, county and circuit clerk and soldier. Madison County, Kentucky, native. Married to Prudence Patrick. Father of Armina C. Patrick, Samuel H. Patrick, James C. Patrick, Amelia Belle Patrick, John M. E. Patrick, and George C. Patrick. Clerk of the Breathitt County Court in Breathitt County from c1850 to 1864. Clerk of the Breathitt Circuit Court in Breathitt County from c1850 to 1864. Owned one enslaved person in Breathitt County in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Breathitt County in 1860. Served in the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private from May 10, 1863 to June 30, 1863.
